intro: Navarretia prolifera var. breviflora, commonly known as the narrowleaf navarretia, is a flowering plant native to California and parts of Nevada. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal dunes. It blooms from late winter to early spring, producing numerous seed pods that disperse its seeds by wind. Navarretia prolifera var. breviflora is an important component of local ecosystems and is often found in disturbed or early successional habitats.
